subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Hijra: Migration That Made a Nation
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Hijra: Migration That Made a Nation usable.

hook.text: Mecca wanted him dead. He fled to Medina. That journey marks Year One of the Islamic calendar. Everything changed.

buildup.text: By 622 CE, Mecca's elite were plotting to assassinate Muhammad. His followers faced torture and boycotts.

discovery.text: Muhammad migrated to Medina, where he was invited as a leader. The Hijra transformed him from preacher to statesman.

twist.text: In Medina, Muhammad built a constitution that united Jews, Christians, and Muslims under one civic agreement.

climax.text: The Hijra created the first Islamic state. A refugee became a ruler. Exile became the foundation of a civilization.

punchline.text: A refugee built a nation. The Hijra is Year One of Islamic history.

quiz.question: What was the Hijra?
options: Muhammad's migration from Mecca to Medina in 622 CE
